comments.body: Both CMC and Coingecko have a trust score ranking and this how it's calculated: https://support.coinmarketcap.com/hc/en-us/articles/360052030111-Exchange-RankingThe questions we must ask now is...are they biased? Since Binance is always #1 with a perfect score. Are they trying to eliminate competition? etc.But to answer your question, it's difficult to say without knowing the exchange name, since bestchange has multiple exchanges and not only one, or are you talking about instant exchanges in general? But then, it also depends on your preferences, what is it that you want to trade? Just BTC and stablecoins? Do you care about going through KYC etc.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHFs on July 07, 2023, 06:46:02 AMOut of CMC ranking can you guys tell the most trusted bitcoin exchanges? What is the real order of them whether dex or cex and do you think it's better to use bestchange for coins exchange than cex?since CMC owned by Binance It is unlikely that all their statistics are unbiased. In the end, if Binance fails, CMC will be sold, and the price may not be good if Binance needs liquidity or liquidation of its assets, and therefore we cannot rely on it as an independent source to confirm the extent of confidence in any platform, especially the numbers related to Binance and its competitors.I tried to make a list, but it needs constant updating, and one piece of news can turn a platform from highly reliable into a scam. The story of the FTX collapse did not take more than a month.
